supporting_evidence: ChCl:EG:Gly:Urea:ZnCl₂ (1:2:1:1:0.5) achieves 1.0 g/L noble metal solubility at 25°C, confirming feasibility of this component set.
Urea- and polyol-based HBDs synergistically depress melting point in multi-component DES systems, enabling liquid state at 25°C.
ZnCl₂ acts as a Lewis acid to promote oxidative dissolution of noble metals; higher molar ratios enhance metal coordination and chloro-complex formation.
Increasing ZnCl₂ concentration in choline chloride-based DES improves solubilization of metals like Au and Pd, though viscosity must be balanced.
final_result.synergy_explanation: The combination of urea, ethylene glycol, and glycerol creates a dense hydrogen-bonding network that stabilizes the liquid eutectic phase at room temperature, while choline chloride organizes the anionic framework. ZnCl₂ integrates into this network as a Lewis acid, providing Cl⁻ ligands and redox-active sites that facilitate oxidation and complexation of noble metals; its interaction is enhanced by the high donor availability from the multi-HBD matrix, resulting in cooperative solvation and improved dissolution capacity.
